sentences.en: As soon as they found out I was a doctor, their whole attitude changed.
sentences.cn: 他们一听说我是医生，态度就完全改变了。

sentences.en: Beauty is an attitude. It has nothing to do with age.
sentences.cn: 美是一种态度，与年龄无关。

sentences.en: He maintained an ambivalent attitude to the Church throughout his long life.
sentences.cn: 在他漫长的一生中，他对基督教信仰始终是一种摇摆不定的态度。

sentences.en: He was kneeling by his bed in an attitude of devotion.
Her hands were folded in an attitude of prayer.
sentences.cn: 她双手合拢成祈祷姿势。

sentences.en: I eventually realized I had to change my attitude toward medical practice.
sentences.cn: 我终于认识到自己不得不改变对医务工作的看法。

sentences.en: Lisa was irritated by the slovenly attitude of her boyfriend Sean.
sentences.cn: 莉萨对男朋友肖恩吊儿郎当的态度非常恼火。

sentences.en: Remember, keep a positive attitude and good things will happen.
sentences.cn: 记住：保持乐观的心态，好事自然会发生。

sentences.en: That shows a fairly careless attitude to clothes, doesn't it?
sentences.cn: 那表明此人不讲究穿着，是吧？

sentences.en: The attitude of the medical profession is very much more liberal now.
sentences.cn: 现在，医务人员的态度开明多了。

sentences.en: The Editor takes a cavalier attitude to the concept of fact checking.
sentences.cn: 《编辑》杂志对于核对事实这一点采取无所谓的态度。

sentences.en: There was something in her attitude that bothered him.
sentences.cn: 她的态度里有某种东西让他感到不安。

sentences.en: There was something strange in her attitude which mystified me.
sentences.cn: 她态度有些奇怪，让我迷惑不解。

sentences.en: They said she had a servile attitude to her employer.
sentences.cn: 他们说她对她的老板阿谀逢迎。

sentences.en: This very careful attitude to money can sometimes border on meanness.
sentences.cn: 这种对待金钱的过分谨慎的态度有时几近于吝啬。

sentences.en: We would have thought he would have a more responsible attitude.
sentences.cn: 我们本以为他会采取更负责的态度。

sentences.en: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.--Zig Ziglar
sentences.cn: 决定你人生高度的，不是你的才能，而是你的态度。

trans.tran_cn: 态度，看法，姿势，我行我素的作风
trans.tran_en: the opinions and feelings that you usually have about something, especially when this is shown in your behaviour
